title: FTSE LIVE: Pound holds above $1.29 amid Brexit standoff; Just Eat sales surge
text:
The pound slipped from its five-month highs overnight, but is still holding above $1.29 in early trading on Monday, ahead of another attempt by the Government to hold its meaningful vote on Brexit.

Prime Minister Boris Johnson believes he 'has the numbers' to get his withdrawal agreement through the Commons by the end of this week.

Just Eat has posted rapidly growing sales in the third quarter despite a backdrop of 'softer consumer spending'.

The food delivery company saw sales jump 25 per cent in the three months to September, although this represented a slowdown from the previous half-year.
description: The pound slipped from its five-month highs overnight, but is still holding above $1.29 in early trading on Monday, ahead of another attempt by the Government to hold its meaningful vote on Brexit.
authors: Emily Hardy For This Is Money
